image.altText: City office-workers and passers-by watch the ASX board in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are on the rise after heavy losses, after several sessions of heavy selling, while investors worry about an economic slowdown. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Australian shares snap losing streak with 2.3pc gain for ASX 200

image.altText: A screenshot of a map of Sydney with gold highlighted areas on different suburbs.

props.synopsis: Property developers and home owners alike in NSW are cashing in after new planning laws to help build hundreds of thousands of apartments came into effect in February.

title.children: 'Biggest single change' to Sydney planning rules sees house prices soar

image.altText: Wall Street sign with the American flag on the New York Stock Exchange behind

props.synopsis: With trillions of dollars wiped off global markets, the impact extends beyond stock exchanges into the broader economy. Here's why the effects have a much quicker transmission process into our everyday lives than they once did.

title.children: Wall Street vs Main Street: Why markets matter more than you think

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up Medicare card

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are both in Sydney ahead of the first leaders debate for the 2025 campaign trail. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese, Dutton pause campaigning to prep for first election debate

image.altText: Dutton Taylor campaign recession conference

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says Labor is badly prepared to weather the economic fallout from Donald Trump's tariffs, contradicting assessments from Treasurer Jim Chalmers and RBA governor Michele Bullock.

title.children: 'Recession under Labor': Dutton stokes fears of Trump crash

image.altText: A man in a royal blue suit, white shirt and light blue tie sits in a room with red carpet looking toward something out of frame

props.synopsis: Beijing says Donald Trump's tariffs will increase the divide between rich and poor nations, as countries across the region grapple with what to do next.

title.children: 'China's economy is an ocean': Xi unfazed by Trump tariffs

image.altText: Am aerial shot of a house with solar panels along the top and two people standing on the lawn.

props.synopsis: The Consumer Action Law Centre has used its new powers to make a "super complaint" to demand a ban on door-to-door sales, an issue they say has harmed vulnerable people for decades.

title.children: Christine wishes she'd never let the solar salesman through the door

image.altText: A graphic showing Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton imposed onto a red and blue background

props.synopsis: Australia is at the pointy end of a mental health crisis. Here's what the major parties are offering at the election and what the experts think of those promises.

title.children: The differences between Labor and the Coalition's mental health policies

image.altText: Virginia Trioli and Kate Ceberano stand together smiling in a room with art on wall behind them.

props.synopsis: In the 1980s, Kate Ceberano was experiencing the wrong kind of recognition: backlash for comments she'd made about Kylie Minogue. Now, the singer reflects on how jealousy was impacting her.

title.children: Kate Ceberano was slammed for criticising Kylie. It led to this realisation

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a business shirt smiles while posing for a portrait.

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party's replacement for its dumped candidate in the NSW seat of Whitlam is a director of a pro-gas group accused of misleading voters ahead of next month's federal election.

title.children: Replacement Liberal candidate a director of 'misleading' pro-gas group

image.altText: Rising tide protester at Albo presser

props.synopsis: Both leaders are preoccupied with economic uncertainty as they prepare to go head-to-head in tonight's debate (with a little help from a former premier).

title.children: Bird-dogging disrupts campaign trail as leaders get ready for first debate

image.altText: Composite image of six smiling women.

props.synopsis: Deep in Queensland's blue-blood heartland, six female independent candidates are aiming to dismantle decades of an LNP stranglehold on power.

title.children: Six teals fighting against history, safe seats to change Qld politics

image.altText: A helicopter suspended in mid-air, its chopper blades blurred as they rotate.

props.synopsis: New Zealand is not exactly known as a major military power, but it plans to nearly double its defence spending. What is driving this strategic shift and what are the implications for the region?

title.children: China threat prompts NZ to develop 'modern, combat-capable' defence force

image.altText: two men wearing suits smiling in a city

props.synopsis: More details are emerging of extremist and racist content regularly shared inside a Telegram channel that has been linked to an outspoken and recently dumped Liberal Party candidate for this year's federal election.

title.children: Dumped Liberal candidate joined chat group hosting antisemitic and extremist conspiracies

image.altText: A male hanging his arms and head out of a Toyota Hilux car window

props.synopsis: The video posted to social media shows a man throwing what appears to be the body of a dead dingo into a car's path, before it is driven over.

title.children: 'Disgusting' video of group defiling dead animal sparks outrage

image.altText: Runners cross the finish line on a blue athletics running track at night.

props.synopsis: The handicaps for the historic Stawell Gift have been announced, with Lachlan Kennedy the backmark in the men's race with Gout Gout just ahead.

title.children: Gout Gout, Lachlan Kennedy to resume rivalry 75cm apart at Stawell Gift

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair stands behind a succulent house plant in a home with pictures on the wall.

props.synopsis: Living alone was great until the loneliness kicked in, writes Eleanor Burnard.

title.children: I live alone. Here's what I do to feel less lonely

image.altText: Seth

props.synopsis: Members of Australia's biggest superannuation fund say they asked about a key safeguard against online fraud before cyber thieves stole retirement savings.

title.children: Customers asked super fund about security weakness before cyberattacks

image.altText: Three women standing together.

props.synopsis: For residents of Altadena, hopes of rebuilding their community just as it was are facing mounting challenges.

title.children: Their house burned down in the LA fires. Then the predatory phone calls started

image.altText: Officer Cadets on parade at ADFA.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for an ADFA cadet accused of raping a colleague tell an ACT Supreme Court jury it must decide if the woman was pressured into consent or made a complaint because she regretted the encounter.

title.children: Jury hears ADFA cadet accused of raping colleague 'wasn't asking'

image.altText: An aerial shot of a town surrounded by water

props.synopsis: The NSW State Emergency Service is responding to ongoing flooding as flows from Queensland cause river rises to pass historic levels.

title.children: Residents isolated as record flooding hits western NSW

image.altText: A Colossal Biosciences press photo of a two genetically modified 'dire wolf' pups at three months old

props.synopsis: A US startup claims to have brought an extinct species back into existence. It's prompted debate about the difference of resurrecting an extinct species and genetically modifying an existing one.

title.children: A startup says it has 'de-extincted' dire wolves. But what does that actually mean?

image.altText: A boat on Lake Burley Griffin

props.synopsis: Police say it's a miracle no one was injured during the alleged cross-border chase. The driver later tested positive to drugs, with police finding weapons in his car.

title.children: Police say pursuit ended as driver jumped into Lake Burley Griffin

image.altText: A serious-looking Will Day of Hawthorn runs back after kicking a goal, as a teammate reaches out to pat him.

props.synopsis: High-flying Hawthorn hit with a major blow, with star midfielder Will Day to undergo foot surgery and expected to miss up to four months of football.

title.children: 'Bitter blow': Hawthorn star Will Day out for up to four months

props.synopsis: Paris Tier, the partner of GWS defender Conor Stone, found herself in her GP’s office asking to go on Ozempic after receiving online hate comments about her weight.

title.children: AFL partners divulge ‘lifelong body dysmorphia’ from online trolling

image.altText: Drone shot of water and port surrounding a steelwork factory

props.synopsis: KordaMentha is attempting to take control of the Whyalla port from its current operator, a subsidiary of GFG Alliance.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks administrator launches legal action to regain control of port operations

image.altText: smoke bellows out of a volcano after it erupts

props.synopsis: Kanlaon Volcano, one of 24 active volcanoes in the Philippines, has erupted, with social media videos showing a plume of ash rising into the sky.

title.children: Ash soars kilometres into air as Philippines volcano erupts

image.altText: Trump waves as he walks across a lawn in a jacket

props.synopsis: It may be the world's largest economy, the global military superpower. But America is beset with problems.

title.children: Why America will be the biggest loser in Trump's tariff war

image.altText: A man in combat gear walks over sand towards a damaged apartment building

props.synopsis: Five witnesses tell the ABC that multiple civilians were targeted and killed by the IDF when they were supposed to have safe passage out of the city of Tel Al-Sultan.

title.children: As Abir fled her home on IDF orders, she said she made a horror discovery

image.altText: King Charles and Queen Camilla interlock their arms and smile to the camera

props.synopsis: The royals have been photographed at Villa Wolkonsky, the British ambassador's residence in Rome.

title.children: Charles and Camilla mark 20th anniversary with photos in Rome

image.altText: An aerial view of a wharf part of the Darwin Port, with the city of Darwin in the distance.

props.synopsis: A former NT minister has defended the 99-year lease of the Darwin port to a Chinese-owned company, as both the Coalition and Labor promise to return it to Australian hands.

title.children: ‘China was the Asian tiger’: Darwin port 99-year lease deal defended

image.altText: Five staff members of a resort stand on the beach and wave happily with their left hands

props.synopsis: The villas are locked, the boats have set sail, the body bag has been zipped: The White Lotus is off-season for another year. Here's where it left us.

title.children: The latest White Lotus season showed how beliefs can create and destroy

image.altText: A man in a yellow t-shirt with an Aboriginal flag on it.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian Aboriginal elder who says he does not recognise "colonial courts" has come into a courtroom to directly address a magistrate, resulting in an argument between the two men.

title.children: Aboriginal elder and magistrate argue over court's 'jurisdiction'

image.altText: Woman walks from court surronded by a group of cameramen

props.synopsis: A mother-of-five who drove through a stop sign and crashed into a police car had consumed an entire cask of wine and had cannabis in her system, a court has heard.

title.children: Drunk driver drank whole cask before slamming into police car
